TITLE: Documenting Installation Instructions for Armok Vision in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Provides installation requirements and instructions for Armok Vision, including the need for Dwarf Fortress with DFHack, and options for obtaining the necessary RemoteFortressReader plugin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rosarymala/armok-vision/blob/master/ReleaseFiles/Readme.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
*** Installation ***
    At a minimum, Armok Vision needs a copy of Dwarf Fortress with a recent build of DFHack installed
on top of it. 
    For a complete experience, you either need a copy of DFHack built after the current version of
Armok Vision was released, or an updated RemoteFortressReader plugin for your platform. If none is
available, you can follow the instructions at https://github.com/DFHack/dfhack/blob/master/docs/Compile.rst
to build your own. You will need to build from the develop branch of DFHack.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Cloning Armok Vision Repository with Git
DESCRIPTION: Command to clone the Armok Vision repository using Git, including submodules. The --depth 1 flag is optional for a smaller download size.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rosarymala/armok-vision/blob/master/README.md#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ git clone --recurse-submodules --depth 1 https://github.com/JapaMala/armok-vision.git
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Armok Vision using DFHack
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for installing Armok Vision using DFHack, including the necessary command to run in the DFHack console.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rosarymala/armok-vision/blob/master/Assets/StreamingAssets/graphics/graphics_example.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
```
armok-vision enable
```
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Disabling Armok Vision using DFHack
DESCRIPTION: Command to disable Armok Vision using the DFHack console.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rosarymala/armok-vision/blob/master/Assets/StreamingAssets/graphics/graphics_example.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
```
armok-vision disable
```
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Structuring Camera Rig Hierarchy in Unity
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the typical hierarchy setup for camera rigs, showing the positioning of the Camera Rig, Pivot, and Camera objects. This structure allows for easy adjustment of camera height, horizontal offset, and distance from the target.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rosarymala/armok-vision/blob/master/Assets/Standard Assets/Cameras/CameraGuidelines.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Camera Rig			<- position will move towards target.
	Pivot			<- adjust Y position for height, X position for horizontal offset
		Camera		<- adjust Z position for distance away from target
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: GPL License Header Template for Source Files
DESCRIPTION: Standard template text to be included at the beginning of source files in GPL-licensed projects. This header identifies the program, specifies copyright information, and outlines the basic freedoms and conditions of the GPL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rosarymala/armok-vision/blob/master/Assets/Scripts/hqxSharp/GPL 3.0.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
<one line to give the program's name and a brief idea of what it does.>
Copyright (C) <year>  <name of author>

This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
(at your option) any later version.

This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the
GNU General Public License for more details.

You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
along with this program.  If not, see <http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Interactive Program GPL Notice Template
DESCRIPTION: Template for a short GPL notice to be displayed when interactive programs start. This provides users with basic information about the program's license and how to view the full warranty and distribution terms.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rosarymala/armok-vision/blob/master/Assets/Scripts/hqxSharp/GPL 3.0.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
<program>  Copyright (C) <year>  <name of author>
This program comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY; for details type `show w'.
This is free software, and you are welcome to redistribute it
under certain conditions; type `show c' for details.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Reading CrossPlatformInput Axis in C#
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to read the 'Horizontal' axis using CrossPlatformInput. This method returns either the real input value for non-mobile targets or the mobile control rig value for mobile platforms.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rosarymala/armok-vision/blob/master/Assets/Standard Assets/CrossPlatformInput/CrossPlatformInputGuidelines.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
CrossPlatformInput.GetAxis("Horizontal")
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing CrossPlatformInput Functions in C#
DESCRIPTION: Lists the main functions provided by the CrossPlatformInput class for reading axes and buttons. These functions mirror Unity's Input class API.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rosarymala/armok-vision/blob/master/Assets/Standard Assets/CrossPlatformInput/CrossPlatformInputGuidelines.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: csharp
CODE:
```
GetAxis, GetAxisRaw
GetButton, GetButtonDown, GetButtonUp
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Human Graphics Tile Configuration in Dwarf Fortress RAWS
DESCRIPTION: Configures graphics tile mappings for human characters using a 24x24 pixel tileset organized in a 15x14 grid. Includes definitions for various professions, nobility titles, and character states like drunk or ghost.

LANGUAGE: RAWS

	[FILE:humans.png]

TITLE: Documenting Controls for Armok Vision in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Lists the keyboard and mouse controls for navigating and interacting with the Armok Vision 3D visualization of Dwarf Fortress. Includes movement, time control, view options, and screenshot functionality.
SOURCE: https://github.com/rosarymala/armok-vision/blob/master/ReleaseFiles/Readme.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
*** Controls ***
    W, A, S, D, and middle click drag: Move horizontally.
    Q, E: Move up and down.
    P: Pause and resume sun movement.
    [, ]: Change time of day. This automatically pauses the sun movement.
    O: Toggle shadows being casted from hidden Z-levels.
    L: Toggle scaling of creatures based on their size.
    `: Toggle showing the Dwarf Fortress screen.
    F: Toggle following the center of the dwarf fortress screen.
    Esc: Open options menu.
    F9: Save Screenshot.
    Ctrl+F9: Save minimap.
    Mouse wheel zooms in and out.
    Right click drag rotates the view.
```
